If \\( f(z) \\) is applied to a complex number \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\dot{z} = i\\omega z \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) had been directly evolved to t = T under \\( \\dot{z} = i\\omega z \\)?

Thus, \\( z(t) \\) will involve both the effect of the transformation and the original differential equation, yielding a trajectory distinct from mere evolution under \\( \\dot{z} = i\\omega z \\) alone.
